fields.summary: Android: Splash screen stretched on the app launch if device in landscape

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
When launching the attached TiTest app, the splash screen momentarily appears as stretched in landscape mode and then quickly appears normally in landscape mode. This is not very noticeable in faster phones (though I was briefly able to see it on a Nexus S running 2.3.4), but can be better seen in slower phones such as the HTC Hero running 2.1 Update1.

A way I was able to reproduce this consistently was by letting the phone go to sleep and then activating it again. When I do this, the splash screen appears normally in portrait mode, then stretched in landscape mode, and then normally in landscape mode.
fields.summary: Android: When splash screen orientation is set to landscape, splash screen appears stretched momentarily before being displayed normally.
fields.environment:
HTC Hero 2.1update1, Nexus S 2.3.4
SDK:
version=1.8.0

comments.body: This looks to be a duplicate of TIMOB-5233, please refer to that ticket in future. Closing.
